meanings.definition: To tame or train (an animal) to live in close association with human beings.
meanings.sent1: She is domesticating the wild rabbit by feeding it every day.
meanings.sent2: The farmer is domesticating the new horse on the ranch.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel is domesticating the backyard by storing nuts everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The teacher is domesticating the rowdy class with her calm demeanor.
meanings.sent5: The zookeeper is domesticating the young lion, teaching it to respond to commands.

meanings.definition: To make (something) more familiar or manageable; to adapt to domestic life.
meanings.sent1: He is domesticating the new computer software for easier use.
meanings.sent2: The family is domesticating the old house by renovating it.
meanings.sent3: The child is domesticating the toy room by organizing all the toys.
meanings.sent4: The chef is domesticating the exotic spices into everyday dishes.
meanings.sent5: The gardener is domesticating the wildflowers into a beautiful garden.

meanings.definition: To bring (a country or region) under control or into a state of order.
meanings.sent1: The general is domesticating the war-torn region by establishing peace.
meanings.sent2: The government is domesticating the economy through new policies.
meanings.sent3: The mayor is domesticating the chaotic city streets with better traffic management.
meanings.sent4: The coach is domesticating the unruly team into a disciplined unit.
meanings.sent5: The scientist is domesticating the unruly data into meaningful patterns.
